summary: This is an FBI 302 interview report documenting an interview with MCC inmate Leonardo Fernandez conducted on August 16, 2019, regarding his observations of Jeffrey Epstein's routine in the Special Housing Unit prior to Epstein's death. Fernandez provides details about his own movements and Epstein's schedule but states he has no information about Epstein's death.

persons.name: Leonardo Fernandez
persons.context: Was interviewed regarding his observations of Jeffrey Epstein's routine in the Special Housing Unit. He was housed in cell 218 on L-Tier and was moved after a visit from his girlfriend.

persons.name: Tyrelyshanti Criag
persons.context: Visited inmate Leonardo Fernandez at MCC on August 9, 2019, after which Fernandez was suspected of receiving contraband and placed in a dry room.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Was housed in cell 220 on L-Tier. Fernandez observed that Epstein would be 'in legal' from approximately 9am to 9pm.

connections.description: Fernandez identifies Criag as his girlfriend, who visited him at MCC on August 9, 2019.
Both were inmates housed on the same tier (L-Tier) in the MCC Special Housing Unit. Fernandez observed Epstein's daily routine.

events.title: Fernandez's Visit and Cell Move
events.description: Leonardo Fernandez received a visit from his girlfriend, Tyrelyshanti Criag, at MCC. He was subsequently suspected of receiving contraband, placed in a dry room for ~25 hours, and then moved from cell 218 on L-Tier to cell 111 on K-Tier.

events.title: FBI Interview of Fernandez
events.description: FBI agents and other officials interviewed MCC inmate Leonardo Fernandez regarding his observations of Jeffrey Epstein's routine prior to Epstein's death.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), 150 Park Row, New York, NY
Special Housing Unit, L-Tier, Cell 218 (Fernandez's cell)
Special Housing Unit, L-Tier, Cell 220 (Epstein's cell)
Dry room (location where Fernandez was held)
keyFacts: Inmate Leonardo Fernandez was housed in cell 218 on L-Tier of the MCC Special Housing Unit, adjacent to Jeffrey Epstein's cell 220.
Fernandez observed that Jeffrey Epstein would be 'in legal' from approximately 9am to 9pm each day.
Fernandez stated he had no information regarding the death of Jeffrey Epstein.
The interview was part of the FBI investigation into Epstein's death, as indicated by the file number 90A-NY-3151227.
Fernandez was moved from L-Tier after a visit from his girlfriend led to suspicion he received contraband.
